alert.note: Alert for Scott (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 24 at 10:33AM CDT until August 24 at 2:30PM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD EMERGENCY FOR MORTON TO FOREST AREAS... The National Weather Service in Jackson has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Central Scott County in central Mississippi... * Until 230 PM CDT. * At 1033 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 6 and 12 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 2 to 4 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. This is a FLASH FLOOD EMERGENCY for Morton to Forest areas. This is a PARTICULARLY DANGEROUS SITUATION. SEEK HIGHER GROUND NOW! HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...This is a PARTICULARLY DANGEROUS SITUATION. SEEK HIGHER GROUND NOW! Life threatening flash flooding of low water crossings, small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Forest, Morton, Hillsboro, Forkville, Pulaski and Branch. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CATASTROPHIC
info.instruction: Move to higher ground now! This is an extremely dangerous and life-threatening situation. Do not attempt to travel unless you are fleeing an area subject to flooding or under an evacuation order. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
